intro: Geum rossii var. rossii, commonly known as Rosy Meadow-rue, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It features upright, branched stems that bear clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant has palmately divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy and dark green. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Geum rossii var. rossii is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
